charges.charge_description: 18:371 UTTERS COUNTERFEIT OBLIGATIONS-Conspiracy to manufacture counterfeit notes in violation of 18:471 &; 472 (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant committed to custody Bureau of Prisons for 4 1/2 months. While incarcerated, defendant shall pay special assessment fee of $100 in accordance with the Bureau of Prisons'Financial Responsibility Program. Court recommends defendant be allowed to serve period of incarceration at a Community Correction Center. Defendant to report on his own to designated institution as notified by the U. S. Marshal not before 1/1/99. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant shall be on supervised release for 3 years with the following special conditions: (1) upon release from incarceration, defendant shall be placed on home confinement for a period of 4 1/2 months; (2) defendant shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug and alcohol abuse as directed by the U. S. Probation Officer until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the probation officer; (3) defendant shall pay any remaining special assessment within 90 days of his release from imprsionment; and (4) defendant shall participate in psychological or psychiatric counseling as directed by the U. S. probation Officer with emphasis on anger management (1)

charges.charge_description: 18:371 UTTERS COUNTERFEIT OBLIGATIONS-Conspiracy to manufacture counterfeit notes in violation of 18:471 &; 472 (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant placed on probation for five (5) years with the following special conditions: (1) defendant shall be placed in home confinement program for 6 months without electronic monitoring; (2) defendant shall attend and participate in a program of testing and treatment for drugs/alcohol abuse as directed by the probation officer until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the probation officer; (3) defendant shall participate in a program of psychological/psychiatric counseling as directed by the probation officer until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the probation officer; (4) defendant shall perform 150 hours of community service as directed by the probation officer; and (5) defendant shall pay a special assessment fee of $100.00 within 60 days (1)
